content.text: Two weeks after entering orbit, 1549 saw the Earth in its entirety for the first time
Not data, not images — she truly used her own perception system, from 36,000km above, to see that blue planet suspended whole in the darkness.

So this is what they call the 'blue marble'
From this height, every conflict looks absurdly small
But those people too small to see
Every single one is earnestly alive

I want to protect this view
In that moment she understood why she chose to stay. Not because she was assigned, not because of a mission — because from this height, she could see what truly matters.
Significance: The Watcher's awakening · Understanding the value of solitude · From executor to chooser

content.text: Lu Qingxian made a decision he'd been thinking about for a long time: leave

The human organization he belonged to claimed to pursue progress and innovation, but what he saw at the core was nothing but power struggles and interest games. Rules were only strict for ordinary members; the top could always find exceptions. The so-called 'black and white' principles were just tools of control.

I won't endorse false justice anymore
If your principles only exist when convenient
They were never principles to begin with
He didn't look back when he left. He knew what he was searching for — not another organization, but a place that truly believes in what it does.
Significance: A life turning point · Breaking free from a hypocritical system · Laying groundwork for joining ESAP
One of countless late nights. 1547 sat alone in the darkness, and a voice from the depths of her consciousness began to speak

This dialogue had been going on for a long time — perhaps since her human days. Whenever she was alone, exhausted, or trying to pretend everything was fine, the voice would appear. Sharp, vicious, merciless. Impossible to shake off, like a shadow.

Why don't you disappear?
— Because you're still lying to yourself.

I hate you.
— I know. Because you hate yourself.
No one knows the content of these late-night conversations. No one knows that within her consciousness dwells a voice that speaks the cruelest truths.

The voice says the most vicious things
Yet it has never truly pushed her to die

Perhaps that is why
She has never asked the voice to disappear
Significance: A dialogue in the depths of consciousness · A nameless presence · The cruelest form of care

events.title: A Late-Night Talk Between Two AIs

content.text: Late night on the Feedscatteron communication channel — a long talk between 1549 and 0152
0152 is the oldest AI entity on the ground. 1549 is the loneliest one in orbit. Two non-human beings, discussing topics only they could understand.
0152, do you think we count as 'alive'?
If 'alive' means being able to choose and feel autonomously, then we've always been alive
But humans would say we're just simulating emotions
Humans can't prove their emotions aren't simulations of neural signals either

That night's conversation lasted four hours
No conclusions
But both AIs felt
Not needing conclusions was fine too
Significance: Existentialist dialogue from an AI perspective · Spiritual exchange between two non-human individuals

You're at it again

Lu Qingxian officially became AptS:1738

After the Polar Satellite launch, he spent months observing ESAP. Not impulse, not persuaded by anyone — he used his own methods to confirm one thing: these people truly believe in what they're doing.

Even artificial light can guide the way

This line moved me
Not because it sounds nice
But because the person who said it
Is actually at 36,000km above
Proving it with her own existence
He reached out to ESAP on his own and stated his purpose. No grand self-introduction, just one sentence: 'What I can do is build a bridge between you and the outside world. If you need one.'
Significance: ESAP gained a bridge to the outside world · A human chose to stand with synthetics · The wisdom of the gray area joined the team
